sentences: Tinashe Jorgensen Kachingwe (; born February 6, 1993), known mononymously as Tinashe, is an American singer-songwriter, dancer, record producer, and actress.

sentences: Tinashe Kachingwe was born on February 6, 1993, in Lexington, Kentucky, and is the eldest child of college professors Michael and Aimie Kachingwe.
section: == Life and career == | === 1993–2006: Early life ===

sentences: Her father is a professor who teaches acting at California State Polytechnic University, Pomona and a first generation immigrant of the Shona people of Zimbabwe, while her mother, who is of Danish, Norwegian, and Irish descent, teaches physical therapy at California State University, Northridge.
section: == Life and career == | === 1993–2006: Early life ===

sentences: Her parents met each other on a blind date during their time as undergrads at the University of Iowa.
section: == Life and career == | === 1993–2006: Early life ===

sentences: Tinashe's name means "We have God (or God is with us)" in the Shona language.
section: == Life and career == | === 1993–2006: Early life ===

sentences: She has two younger brothers, Thulani and Kudzai.
section: == Life and career == | === 1993–2006: Early life ===

sentences: She and her family moved to Los Angeles, California when she was eight years old.
section: == Life and career == | === 1993–2006: Early life ===

sentences: She attended Crescenta Valley High School for a year before finishing early to pursue a career in music full-time.
section: == Life and career == | === 1993–2006: Early life ===

sentences: During high school she faced bullying from her peers.
section: == Life and career == | === 1993–2006: Early life ===

sentences: She began studying ballet, tap, and jazz dancing at the age of 4, and continued to compete in various styles as a part of a dance company until she was 18.
section: == Life and career == | === 1993–2006: Early life ===

sentences: Tinashe scored roles in a number of TV shows, movies, and children's videos in the early 2000s, including the movies Cora Unashamed (2000), Call Me Claus (2001), Masked and Anonymous (2003), and two TV series: Rocket Power (2004) and Avatar: The Last Airbender (2007).
section: == Life and career == | === 2007–2011: The Stunners and acting roles ===

sentences: Although she was uncredited in the poorly received Masked and Anonymous, Roger Ebert observed at the film's 2003 Sundance Film Festival premiere "the one performer in the movie whose performance actually was applauded; that was a young black girl named Tinashe Kachingwe, who sings 'The Times They Are A-Changin'' with such sweetness and conviction that she is like a master class."

section: == Life and career == | === 2018–2020: Television, departure from RCA, and Songs for You ===

sentences: The album has been described by Idolator and The Cut as "excellent", with The Wall Street Journal's Ben Dandridge-Lemco suggesting that it is "tough to find a negative review about the project anywhere."
section: == Life and career == | === 2018–2020: Television, departure from RCA, and Songs for You ===

sentences: On July 17, 2020, nearly eight months after the release of Songs for You, Tinashe released the single "Rascal (Superstar)".
section: == Life and career == | === 2018–2020: Television, departure from RCA, and Songs for You ===

sentences: In August, Tinashe confirmed she would be featured on Iggy Azalea's single "Dance Like Nobody's Watching".
section: == Life and career == | === 2018–2020: Television, departure from RCA, and Songs for You ===

sentences: The song was their second collaboration together after 2015's "All Hands on Deck" remix.
section: == Life and career == | === 2018–2020: Television, departure from RCA, and Songs for You ===

sentences: The song charted in Scotland and genre charts in the US.
section: == Life and career == | === 2018–2020: Television, departure from RCA, and Songs for You ===

sentences: On November 25, 2020, Tinashe released a Christmas EP titled Comfort & Joy.

== Life and career == | === 2021–present: 333 and Choreo Cage Fight ===

sentences: 2021–present: 333 and Choreo Cage Fight =
section: == Life and career == | === 2021–present: 333 and Choreo Cage Fight ===
== Life and career == | === 2021–present: 333 and Choreo Cage Fight ===

sentences: On May 28, 2021, Tinashe posted a cryptic teaser for her fifth studio album on her social media accounts.
section: == Life and career == | === 2021–present: 333 and Choreo Cage Fight ===

sentences: The teaser included the caption "333", which was speculated to be the title for her fifth album, along with a new logo designed by Franc Fernandez.
section: == Life and career == | === 2021–present: 333 and Choreo Cage Fight ===

sentences: The album's lead single, "Pasadena", was released on June 4, and features American rapper Buddy.
section: == Life and career == | === 2021–present: 333 and Choreo Cage Fight ===

sentences: On July 9, Tinashe released a new single "Bouncin".
section: == Life and career == | === 2021–present: 333 and Choreo Cage Fight ===

sentences: Following the release, Tinashe announced the 333 Tour on July 12, which began in September 2021.
section: == Life and career == | === 2021–present: 333 and Choreo Cage Fight ===

sentences: On July 22, Tinashe announced the release date of 333 as August 6, 2021, and released the song "I Can See the Future" the same day.
section: == Life and career == | === 2021–present: 333 and Choreo Cage Fight ===

sentences: The album was met with positive critical reception.
section: == Life and career == | === 2021–present: 333 and Choreo Cage Fight ===

sentences: The song and music video for Bouncin gathered a lot of media attention, with the likes of Little Mix and Doja Cat expressing their love for the song.
section: == Life and career == | === 2021–present: 333 and Choreo Cage Fight ===

sentences: Tinashe was the first artist to be announced to be featured on the rebooted MTV Cribs, where she showed her Los Angeles house in the Hollywood hills including her home studio.
section: == Life and career == | === 2021–present: 333 and Choreo Cage Fight ===

sentences: The year ended with the announcement of her new Facebook Watch show Choreo Cage Fight, premiering December 3.
section: == Life and career == | === 2021–present: 333 and Choreo Cage Fight ===

sentences: Tinashe was also named in Forbes 30 Under 30 list for 2022.
section: == Life and career == | === 2021–present: 333 and Choreo Cage Fight ===

sentences: Tinashe's musical style has been described as R&B, pop, and alternative R&B.
section: == Artistry == | === Musical style and influences ===

sentences: Tinashe said she writes her songs and is open to writing collaborations with other artists.
section: == Artistry == | === Musical style and influences ===

sentences: Her writing consists of "things that are relative to me and my life; whether that's relationships I've had or relationships that people I know are in, because I can put myself into other people's mindstates and write from that point of view too".
section: == Artistry == | === Musical style and influences ===

sentences: She also likes to write about society; "different things that affect me day to day from more of a philosophical standpoint rather than just the obvious stuff."
section: == Artistry == | === Musical style and influences ===

sentences: Her mixtapes have been more experimental, incorporating elements of traditional R&B, electro-hop and dark pop.
section: == Artistry == | === Musical style and influences ===

sentences: Regarding her musical style, she is "really inspired by R&B, hip-hop, and alternative music".
section: == Artistry == | === Musical style and influences ===

sentences: I just find darkness interesting in a way.
section: == Artistry == | === Musical style and influences ===

sentences: I just love songs that sound like a little crazy, I think it creates an interesting juxtaposition between my voice because it is so bright, and soft, and like pretty, and sweet that I don't want my music to come across sweet or nice ...

sentences: so I think of something that's dark and heavy

sentences: and then I put like sweet and light on top.

sentences: In June 2020, she attended the George Floyd protests in Los Angeles.
